Body: Possible Duplicate:  Google play fails to install application with RPC:S-5:AEC-0  I recently bought 2 of these tablets, which had good reviews. I bought them for my young daughters for Christmas. So, the tablets didn't have to be the best in the market. They need to be able to download games, but I am having problems with downloading from the Play Store.The most frequent error is the RPC:S-5:AEC-0 error. All the fixes I have found for this are for problems following updates, and not for brand new devices. Nevertheless, I have tried clearing caches, re-installing GMail accounts, and restoring to factory settings but nothing is working.The above link shows that the devices are on 4.0.3. But when I checked the tablets, they are on 4.0.4.Any ideas?
Title: RPC:S-5:AEC-0 error on brand new tablets

history.Text: I recently brought 2 of theses tabs http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0099NPR7U/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00 most of the reviews for which were good.They are for my young daughters for Christmas so didn't need to be the bets 7" Tabs on the market just for them to play a few games on.They do however need to be able to download the games in the first place.I'm having major problems with both of them downloading from PlayStore.The most frequent error message is the one in the title.All the fixes i have found for this are for problems following updates and not on brand new devices, never the less i have tried clearing cache's, re-installing gmail accounts and restoring to factory settings but nothing is working.The above link details android operating system 4.0.3 but according to the device they are on 4.0.4Any Ideas?
**URGENT** Double trouble with Play Store RPC:S-5:AEC-0 error on brand new tabs

I recently bought 2 of these [tablets][1], which had good reviews. I bought them for my young daughters for Christmas. So, the tablets didn't have to be the best in the market. They need to be able to download games, but I am having problems with downloading from the Play Store.The most frequent error is the RPC:S-5:AEC-0 error. All the fixes I have found for this are for problems following updates, and not for brand new devices. Nevertheless, I have tried clearing caches, re-installing GMail accounts, and restoring to factory settings but nothing is working.The above link shows that the devices are on 4.0.3. But when I checked the tablets, they are on 4.0.4.Any ideas?  [1]: http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0099NPR7U/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00
RPC:S-5:AEC-0 error on brand new tablets

history.Comment: Proposed by 5342 approved by 475 edit id of 2601

They need to be able to download games, but I am having problems with downloading from the Play Store.The most frequent error is the RPC:S-5:AEC-0 error. All the fixes I have found for this are for problems following updates, and not for brand new devices. Nevertheless, I have tried clearing caches, re-installing GMail accounts, and restoring to factory settings but nothing is working.The above link shows that the devices are on 4.0.3. But when I checked the tablets, they are on 4.0.4.Any ideas?  [1]: http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0099NPR7U/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00
